moves.3... Nf6: Berlin Defence. IT is known for being an extremely solid defence.
moves.4... a6 5. Ba4 Be7: This is turning into a Morphy defence after 4.a6. OF course black can try Nxe4 but that is extremely dangerous.
moves.8... d5: d5 . This is the Marshall Gambit. Extremely dangerous. In my opinion  Black does not get enough compensation for the pawn
moves.9. exd5 Nxd5 10. Nxe5 Nxe5: Standard play in the Marshall gambit.
moves.11. Rxe5 Bd6: This is premature. c6 was a much better continuation. This just drops a knight.
moves.12. Rxd5 c6: There are some traps in here. If I play Rd3 Bxh2+ could be played and black would be in a better situation than being a bishop down.
moves.13. Rd4 c5 14. Re4: Black can gain temporary counterplay but is not able to gain solid play.
moves.18. Be4: Black resigns. He'll be down 2 bishops or queen for rook.
